component.name: cmis
component.title: CMIS
component.description: Read and write data from to/from a CMIS compliant content repositories.
component.label: cms,database

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

sessionFacadeFactory.label: advanced
sessionFacadeFactory.description: To use a custom CMISSessionFacadeFactory to create the CMISSessionFacade instances

cmis:path.label: producer
cmis:path.description: If CamelCMISFolderPath is not set, will try to find out the path of the node from this cmis property and it is name

cmis:name.label: producer
cmis:name.description: If CamelCMISFolderPath is not set, will try to find out the path of the node from this cmis property and it is path

cmis:checkinComment.label: producer
cmis:checkinComment.description: The check-in comment for the document version

cmis:contentStreamMimeType.label: producer
cmis:contentStreamMimeType.description: The mimetype to set for a document

CamelCMISFolderPath.label: producer
CamelCMISFolderPath.description: The current folder to use during the execution. If not specified will use the root folder

CamelCMISDestinationFolderId.label: producer
CamelCMISDestinationFolderId.description: The id of the destination folder

CamelCMISSourceFolderId.label: producer
CamelCMISSourceFolderId.description: The id of the source folder

CamelCMISResultCount.label: producer
CamelCMISResultCount.description: Number of nodes returned from the query

CamelCMISRetrieveContent.label: producer
CamelCMISRetrieveContent.description: In queryMode this header will force the producer to retrieve the content of document nodes.

CamelCMISReadSize.label: producer
CamelCMISReadSize.description: Max number of nodes to read.

CamelCMISAllVersions.label: producer
CamelCMISAllVersions.description: Apply only to this version (false) or all versions (true)

pageSize.description: Number of nodes to retrieve per page

readContent.description: If set to true, the content of document node will be retrieved in addition to the properties

readCount.description: Max number of nodes to read

repositoryId.description: The Id of the repository to use. If not specified the first available repository is used

query.label: consumer
query.description: The cmis query to execute against the repository. If not specified, the consumer will retrieve every node from the content repository by iterating the content tree recursively

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer,advanced
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

queryMode.label: producer
queryMode.description: If true, will execute the cmis query from the message body and return result, otherwise will create a node in the cmis repository

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

sessionFacadeFactory.label: advanced
sessionFacadeFactory.description: To use a custom CMISSessionFacadeFactory to create the CMISSessionFacade instances
